Page.Title: Welcome to the General Compliance Obligations Quiz

Description.div:
On the following pages you will be asked %System_NumberOfQuestions% questions about Stuff.
You may be asked 3 different types of questions: multiple choice, true/false or yes/no. Answer each question by clicking the radio button to the left of the most appropriate response.
After you answer the last question, you will be given the chance to review and then submit your answers.
Please note that if you Exit the quiz before clicking the Submit Answers button then your answers will not be saved.
To move between questions, use the Previous and Next navigation buttons on the bottom right of the page. Do not use your browser back/forward buttons as this will cause you to Exit the quiz.

Question.Description: The main general compliance obligations under the CA 2001 are found in:
The general obligations of AFS licensees are required under s 912A to include doing all things necessary to ensure that the financial services covered by the licence are provided:
Advertisements for financial services and products are allowed if there is compliance with s 1018A. True or false?
Cooling off periods for retail clients under s 1019A relate to the following types of financial services products:

Answer.Description: Risk insurance products; securities and RSA products
Risk insurance products; managed investment products; superannuation products, debentures, securities, options and RSA products
Risk insurance products; investment life insurance products; managed investment products; superannuation products and RSA products

Question.Description: The remedy for a retail client exercising their rights within the cooling off period is to return the financial product and to receive the money they have paid to acquire the product repaid under s 1019B. True or false?

The general obligations of AFS licensees are required under s 912A to include doing all things necessary to ensure that the financial services covered by the licence are provided efficiently, honestly and fairly. True or false?

The AFS licensee or authorised representative must pay the retail clients money into the designated account to satisfy the s 981A obligations on the day it is received or the next business day. True or false?
Unsolicited offers for financial services products must comply with s 1019D and usually relate to financial products or services that are dealt with:

The confirmation of a transaction between a financial services provider and a retail client must provide the identify the issuer of the product and give details of the transaction, such as the date, description of the transaction and any payments made, including taxes/duties. True or false?
The AFS licence has a mixture of standard conditions and specific conditions attached to the licence granted by the ASIC. True or false?
Section 1017F requires certain transactions between financial service providers and retail clients to be confirmed. The responsibility for confirmation obligation is borne by the:

Answer.Description: Issuer or seller of the product

Question.Description: Failing to comply with the advertising provisions for financial services and products may result in:

Answer.Description: A criminal offence and a civil action

Question.Description: It is a criminal offence if the AFS licensee or their authorised representative does not comply with the advertising requirements of CA 2001. True or false?
INACTIVEThe general compliance obligations for the financial services laws are:

Answer.Description: Split into three parts covering the CA 2001 obligations, the ASIC Act and the AFS licence conditions which are specified by the ASIC
Split into three parts covering the CA 2001 obligations, the APRA Act and the AFS licence conditions which are specified by the ASIC
Split into two parts covering the general law obligations and the AFS licence conditions which are specified by the ASIC
Split into two parts covering the CA 2001 obligations and the AFS licence conditions which are specified by the ASIC
